thread.title: Sources: Ryan Carter to attempt a comeback with the Wild
thread.title_full: Sources: Ryan Carter to attempt a comeback with the Wild

title: Sources: Ryan Carter to attempt a comeback with the Wild
text:
Prev 1 /18 Next Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Chicago Blackhawks center Jonathan Toews (19) was able to get the game-winning goal past Minnesota Wild goalie Darcy Kuemper (35) to beat Minnesota in overtime. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Chicago Blackhawks center Jonathan Toews (19) was able to get the game-winning goal past Minnesota Wild goalie Darcy Kuemper (35) to beat Minnesota in overtime. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild goalie Darcy Kuemper (35) blocked a shot by Chicago Blackhawks defenseman Brian Campbell (51) as Minnesota Wild defenseman Matt Dumba (24) and Chicago Blackhawks right wing Marian Hossa (81) battled outside the crease in the final seconds of the first period. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild goalie Darcy Kuemper (35) blocked a shot by Chicago Blackhawks defenseman Brian Campbell (51) as Minnesota Wild defenseman Matt Dumba (24) and Chicago Blackhawks right wing Marian Hossa (81) battled outside the crease in the final seconds of the first period. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Chicago Blackhawks center Jonathan Toews (19) celebrated after scoring the game-winning goal in overtime as Minnesota Wild defenseman Marco Scandella (6) looked on. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild's Mikael Granlund (64) looked on in frustration after the Wild allowed a goal by Chicago Blackhawks center Nick Schmaltz (8), giving Chicago a 2-0 advantage early in the second period. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild center Erik Haula (56) scored a goal past Chicago Blackhawks goalie Corey Crawford (50) late in the third period, forcing overtime. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Chicago Blackhawks center Jonathan Toews (19) defended Minnesota Wild center Eric Staal (12) as he cut behind Chicago's goal Wednesday night in the second period. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild right wing Nino Niederreiter (22) and center Eric Staal (12) celebrated with Erik Haula (56) after Haula tied up the game 3-3 late in the third period against the Chicago Blackhawks. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild defenseman Jared Spurgeon (46) scored a goal on Chicago Blackhawks goalie Corey Crawford (50) despite a blocking attempt by Chicago Blackhawks defenseman Michal Kempny (6) in the second period Wednesday. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Chicago Blackhawks center Tanner Kero (67) celebrated a goal by left wing Ryan Hartman (38) as Minnesota Wild goalie Darcy Kuemper (35) looked on in the third period. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild right wing Nino Niederreiter (22) celebrated with defenseman Jared Spurgeon (46) after Spurgeon scored a goal on Chicago Blackhawks goalie Corey Crawford (50) in the second period Wednesday. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild left wing Zach Parise (11) and Minnesota Wild right wing Chris Stewart (7) celebrated a game-tying goal by Parise in the second period Wednesday. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild right wing Chris Stewart (7) was unable to rebound the puck for a scoring attempt as Chicago Blackhawks goalie Corey Crawford (50) made a block in the first period. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Chicago Blackhawks left wing Vinnie Hinostroza (48) celebrated after dishing an assist to Ryan Hartman (38) for a goal in the first period against the Minnesota Wild. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Chicago Blackhawks center Jonathan Toews (19) lost his footing as he attempted a shot against Minnesota Wild goalie Darcy Kuemper (35) in the first period Wednesday night. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild goalie Darcy Kuemper (35) looked down to the puck in dejection after allowing a goal by Chicago Blackhawks left wing Ryan Hartman (38) in the first period Wednesday night. Aaron Lavinsky – Star Tribune 
Gallery: Minnesota Wild center Erik Haula (56) and Chicago Blackhawks left wing Vinnie Hinostroza (48) battled for the puck in the neutral zone in the first period Wednesday.
